title: Excess baggage
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device The Chinese people given enormous amounts of food - by their parents 9 February 2017 Last updated at 01:24 GMT He became known as "pancake uncle". A Chinese man was spotted taking 15kg of homemade pancakes out of his overweight suitcase at an airport. He'd been given the massive haul of food by his parents. 
When the story reached China's Weibo social network, hashtags such as "Luggage Filled With Love" took off. Thousands shared the edible goods their parents sent them off with after trips home for the Chinese New Year holiday. 
Some posters showed off ludicrous quantities and the trend raised a universal question: what' s so special about food from home? 
Video Journalist: Natalia Zuo 
You can follow BBC Trending on Twitter @BBCtrending , and find us on Facebook . All our stories are at bbc.com/trending . Read more
